peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you know if Asian art is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
HOW DO I KNOW IF MY ASIAN ART IS VALUABLE?
1
Age and Period: Works from significant historical periods (such as Kangxi or Qianlong Dynasty porcelain) often command premium prices.
2
Condition: Original, undamaged pieces typically hold greater value than restored items.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to get Asian art appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Mearto provides quick and affordable online appraisals of Asian art. Click on the "Start Appraisal" button above, follow the steps, and send us information and images of your Asian artwork. Our experienced specialists will review and get back to you with a fair market and insurance value, typically within 48 hours.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much should an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Myth: It's too expensive. Facts: Request a flat fee for the entire appraisal at the outset rather than an hourly rate; you may or may not achieve this, but it can't hurt to ask. A well-executed appraisal will cost approximately $125 - $350 per hour.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Tips for Obtaining a Fine Art Collection Appraisal: Debunking Myths

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get art valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: How much does it cost? The certificate of valuation costs $250 (including GST) for the first artwork, with each additional original painting valued at $125. If you purchased the “Hart” artwork originally from David Hart Galleries, then the cost of the valuations are reduced to $125 each.
